com.cubeia.firebase.service.clientreg.state
Interface StateClientRegistryMBean

public interface StateClientRegistryMBean

JMX interface for the Client Registry.

Author:
Fredrik Johansson, Cubeia Ltd

Method Summary

getNumberOfClients

int getNumberOfClients()

kickPlayer

void kickPlayer(int playerId)
Kick a player from the system. The player will be forcibly logged out and the socket will be closed.

Parameters:
playerId -

kickPlayerFromTable

void kickPlayerFromTable(int playerId,
                         int tableId)
Kick a player from a specific table only. The client will not be logged out or disconnected.

Parameters:
playerId -
tableId -

String getRemoteAddressText(int clientId)
Get a textual representation of a clients remote IP address.

Parameters:
clientId -
Returns:

isLoggedIn

boolean isLoggedIn(int clientId)
Check if a player is logged in to the system. Works system wide.

Parameters:
playerId -
Returns:
true if logged in, false otherwise

getSeatedTables

Map<Integer,Integer> getSeatedTables(int playerId)
Get all tables that a client is seated at.

Parameters:

Returns:
map of table : seat

List<Integer> getWatchingTables(int playerId)
Get all tables that a client is watching.

Parameters:
playerId -
Returns:
List of tables

sendSystemMessage

void sendSystemMessage(int type,
                       int level,
                       String message)
Send a message to all logged in players. The type and level integers are mapped directly against the actual protocol packet variables with the same name, ie. are implementation specific.

Parameters:
type - Message type, implementation specific
level - Message level, implementation specific
message - Message string, may be null

sendSystemMessage

void sendSystemMessage(int type,
                       int level,
                       int[] playerIds,
                       String message)
Send a message to a subset of the logged in players. If a player identified in the player id array is not logged in the message will be dropped. The type and level integers are mapped directly against the actual protocol packet variables with the same name, ie. are implementation specific.

Parameters:
type - Message type, implementation specific
level - Message level, implementation specific
playerIds - Players to send to, or null for all
message - Message string, may be null

getAllLoggedIn

int[] getAllLoggedIn()
Get a list of all clients logged in to the system (client ids). This returns all players from all nodes, and not just locally logged in players.

Returns:

getClientStatusOrdinal

int getClientStatusOrdinal(int clientId)
Get the state of a client. The returned int will be the ordinal of the ClientSessionState enum.

Parameters:
clientId -
Returns:

getClientStatusString

String getClientStatusString(int clientId)
Get the state of a client as a readable string representation.

Parameters:
clientId -
Returns:

getScreenname

String getScreenname(int clientId)
Get the screen name of a client. Client must be logged in to the system.

Parameters:
clientId -
Returns:
Screen name or null if client with given id is not logged in.

isLocal

boolean isLocal(int clientId)
Returns true if the client with the given id is managed on this node locally. This applies both to live clients and clients waiting for reconnects.

Parameters:
pid -
Returns:
True if logged in on this local node. False otherwise
